main event: An air traffic controller observed a bright light over Modoc Point, Oregon on March 6, 1958.
interesting points: The object first appeared as a white flash of light or explosion lasting several seconds before changing to red and blue-black colors., The observation lasted about ten minutes and the object did not resemble any known aircraft., The object was reported to have exhibited zigzag maneuvering., It was observed at an altitude between 500 and 1000 feet., Weather conditions were clear with unlimited visibility during the sighting.
witness description: air traffic controller at the Modoc Point operations tower
